citation.article-title: Taylorella asinigenitalis sp. nov., a bacterium isolated from the genital tract of male donkeys (Equus asinus).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Taylorella asinigenitalis sp. nov.
Taylorella asinigenitalis (a.si.ni.ge.ni.ta'lis. L. masc. n. asinus donkey; L. adj. genitalis genital ; M.L. adj. asinigenitalis pertaining to donkey genitalia)
The bacterium is a Gram-negative, non-motile coccobacillus.
Colonies are approximately 1 mm in diameter, entire, convex, opaque, tan in colour and sometimes viscid in consistency after growth on ECA medium for 48 h.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive, asaccharolytic, does not reduce nitrate, does not hydrolyse aesculin and MRVP-, urease- and indolenegative.
Does not grow on MacConkey agar or ECA medium incubated in air or anaerobically at 37 °C.
Grows microaerophilically and in air with 5-7% CO2 at 37 °C, but not at 24 or 42 °C.
Is not stimulated by haemin or NAD.
Major enzymes present are alkaline phosphatase and leucine arylamidase.
Major fatty acids are 16:0, 18: 0, 19:0 10-methyl and summed features 3, 4 and 7.
Does not appear to produce disease in jacks or mares, although it is contagious and induces an antibody response in infected animals.
The type strain of T. asinigenitalis is UCD-1T (=ATCC 700933T=LMG 19572T).
Strains UK-1 and UK-2 have been deposited in the BCCM}LMG Culture Collection under accession numbers LMG 19573 and LMG 19574, respectively.
